column4: hi, simple question: what do i need to do to get remote x11 connections to work? i got kubuntu-feisty runnig, but i need that box only as a remote x11 terminal
port 6000 is reachable only over lo0
no, thanks, i need x11 connections to work
without nx, vnc, ssh, lalala
ok? ok.
you think i'm not, smo? think more
i know x11 connectivity is ancient
but still ;)
your choice, reiserfs or ext3

remote x11 connections? i removed "-nolisten tcp", rebooted X, did the necessary "xhost +", netstat looks like port 6000 is listening to *:*, but i can telnet to port 6000 only from 127.0.0.1, not from the lan. what the f**k is missing?
stop cursing please
start giving helpful hints instead, please
soon as you stop acting like a jackass I will... follow the rules and you might get more help then you are now
getting mad wont help you to get your prob fixed.sometimes it's best to walk away for an hour or so then come back and attack the issue again
the time you spent with giving me oh so nice hints about behaviour could be used a lot better, imo
I tried being nice to you and me telling you about your attitude is the first step at solving the problems your having but now I see that you need more help then I can offer. Good luck.
I really like people who actualy believe that they are the only ones in the entire universe that the rest of us should concentrate on
?? meow?
i really wish you had a clue
insulting me is not going to help you. btw you seem to be the one without a clue. your behavior is going to end up getting you banned
I cant help you with your issue and I honestly dont want to
